languages.text: "Н-не знаю, откуда я это помню. Быть может, видения о Тисифоне пришли ко мне во снах, но все... я видела все это так отчетливо... В этом монолите было столько силы, столько возможностей... С ним способности навигаторов нашего Дома становились сильнее в разы. Нет. В десятки раз! Но плата была слишком высока — спустя считанные часы взаимодействия монолит выжигал сознание своих носителей. И потому Тисифона расколола его на множество осколков, энергию которых было легче подчинить человеческой воле".

traits.locale_text: "Н-не знаю, откуда я это помню. Быть может, видения о Тисифоне пришли ко мне во снах, но все... я видела все это так отчетливо... В этом камне было столько силы, столько возможностей... С ним способности Навигаторов нашего Дома становились сильнее в разы. Нет. В десятки раз! Но плата была слишком высока — спустя считанные часы взаимодействия камень выжигал сознание своих носителей. И потому Тисифона расколола его на множество осколков, энергию которых было легче подчинить человеческой воле".

languages.text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."
languages.original_text: "Н-не знаю, откуда я это помню. Быть может, видения о Тисифоне пришли ко мне во снах, но все... я видела все это так отчетливо... В этом монолите было столько силы, столько возможностей... С ним способности навигаторов нашего Дома становились сильнее в разы. Нет. В десятки раз! Но плата была слишком высока — спустя считанные часы взаимодействия монолит выжигал сознание своих носителей. И потому Тисифона расколола его на множество осколков, энергию которых было легче подчинить человеческой воле".

There was such power locked within this stone, such possibilities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No. It would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. So Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

languages.text: 「ど、どうしてこんな記憶があたくしにあるのでしょう。おそらく、夢でティシフォンのビジョンを見たのですね。それにしても…何もかもがこんなにはっきり見えるなんて…この石に封じられた大きな力、大きなチャンスを…我々航宙士の能力を数倍に引き上げるもの。いえ、数十倍に増幅するものです！しかし、あまりに大きな代償を払いました。使い始めてからわずか数時間で、石は必ず持ち主の精神を焼きつくしてしまうのです。そこで、ティシフォンはモノリスを破壊して数多の破片にしたのです。そうすれば、一個人がその力を制御しやすくなると考えて」
languages.original_text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

traits.locale_text: 「ど、どうしてこんな記憶があたくしにあるのでしょう。おそらく、夢でティシフォンのビジョンを見たのですね。それにしても…何もかもがこんなにはっきり見えるなんて…この石に封じられた大きな力、大きなチャンスを…我々航宙士の能力を数倍に引き上げるもの。いえ、数十倍に増幅するものです！しかし、あまりに大きな代償を払いました。使い始めてからわずか数時間で、石は必ず持ち主の精神を焼きつくしてしまうのです。そこで、ティシフォンはモノリスを破壊して数多の破片にしたのです。そうすれば、一個人がその力を制御しやすくなると考えて」

「ど、どうしてこんな記憶が私にあるのでしょう。おそらく、夢でティシフォンのヴィジョンを見たのですね。それにしても…何もかもがこんなにはっきり見えるなんて…この石に封じられた大きな力、大きなチャンスを…私たち航宙士の能力を数倍に引き上げるもの。いえ、数十倍に増幅するものです！しかし、あまりに大きな代償を払いました。使い始めてからわずか数時間で、石は必ず持ち主の精神を焼きつくしてしまうのです。そこで、ティシフォンはモノリスを破壊して数多の破片にしたのです。そうすれば、一個人がその力を制御しやすくなると考えて」

languages.text: “我……我不知道这些记忆是怎么来的，或许是因为我在梦境中见过提西福涅的幻象，可现在……这一切我看得是如此清楚……这块巨石里蕴藏着如此强大的力量，如此丰富的机遇……它可以让我们导航者的力量增强几倍，不，可以增强几十倍。但力量的代价太沉重了，只要几个小时，这块石头就会灼烧使用者的心智。正因如此，提西福涅打碎了那块巨型灵魂石，把它变成了无数碎片，这样人类的意志就更容易控制它的力量了。”
languages.original_text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

“我……我不知道这些记忆是怎么来的，或许是因为我在梦境中见过提西福涅的幻象，可现在……这一切我看得是如此清楚……这块巨石里蕴藏着如此强大的力量，如此丰富的机遇……它可以让我们导航者的力量增强几倍，不，可以增强几十倍。但力量的代价太沉重了，只要几个小时，这块石头就会灼烧使用者的心智。正因如此，提西福涅打碎了那块巨型灵魂石，把它变成了无数碎片，这样人类的意志就更容易控制它的力量了。”

languages.text: « Je... j'ignore d'où me vient ce souvenir. J'ai peut-être eu des visions de Tisiphone dans mes rêves, et pourtant... je l'ai vu comme si j'y étais... Cette pierre renfermait tant de puissance, tant de possibilités... Elle devait permettre de multiplier les capacités de nos navigateurs par deux... Non, par dix, voire plus ! Mais le prix à payer était trop élevé. Après seulement quelques heures d'utilisation, la pierre finissait toujours par dévorer l'esprit de son hôte. C'est pour cela que Tisiphone a décidé de briser le Monolithe en de nombreux morceaux, que les humains pourraient contrôler. »
languages.original_text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

traits.locale_text: « Je... j'ignore d'où me vient ce souvenir. J'ai peut-être eu des visions de Tisiphone dans mes rêves, et pourtant... je l'ai vu comme si j'y étais... Cette pierre renfermait tant de puissance, tant de possibilités... Elle devait permettre de multiplier les capacités de nos navigateurs par deux... Non, par dix, voire plus ! Mais le prix à payer était trop élevé. Après seulement quelques heures d'utilisation, la pierre finissait toujours par dévorer l'esprit de son hôte. C'est pour cela que Tisiphone a décidé de briser le Monolithe en de nombreux morceaux, que les humains pourraient contrôler. »

languages.text: «N-no sabría decir de dónde procede este recuerdo. Tal vez tuviera visiones de Tisiphone en sueños, pero... He visto todo esto con tanta claridad... Había tantísimo poder en el interior de esta piedra, tantas oportunidades... Podría hacer que nuestros Navegantes fueran mucho más poderosos. No... ¡decenas de veces más poderosos! Pero el precio era demasiado alto. Tras unas horas de uso, la piedra siempre acaba por consumir la mente de su portador. Por eso Tisiphone rompió el Monolito en fragmentos, para facilitar que la voluntad humana pudiera controlarlos».
languages.original_text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

traits.locale_text: «N-no sabría decir de dónde procede este recuerdo. Tal vez tuviera visiones de Tisiphone en sueños, pero... He visto todo esto con tanta claridad... Había tantísimo poder en el interior de esta piedra, tantas oportunidades... Podría hacer que nuestros Navegantes fueran mucho más poderosos. No... ¡decenas de veces más poderosos! Pero el precio era demasiado alto. Tras unas horas de uso, la piedra siempre acaba por consumir la mente de su portador. Por eso Tisiphone rompió el Monolito en fragmentos, para facilitar que la voluntad humana pudiera controlarlos».

languages.text: "I-Ich kann nicht sagen, woher diese Erinnerung gekommen ist. Vielleicht hatte ich in meinen Träumen Visionen von Tisiphone, und doch ... Und doch habe ich all das so klar gesehen ... Es war eine solche Macht in diesem Stein eingesperrt, solche Gelegenheiten ... Er könnte die Fähigkeiten unserer Navigatoren deutlich verstärken. Nein, er würde sie um ein Dutzendfaches verstärken! Doch der Preis war zu hoch. Nach wenigen Stunden der Nutzung hat der Stein den Verstand seines Wirts unweigerlich verbrannt. Daher hat Tisiphone den Monolith in viele Splitter zerbrochen, die für einen menschlichen Willen viel leichter zu kontrollieren waren."
languages.original_text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

Nein, er würde sie um ein Dutzendfaches verstärken! Doch der Preis war zu hoch. Nach wenigen Stunden der Nutzung hat der Stein den Verstand seines Wirts unweigerlich verbrannt. Daher hat Tisiphone den Monolith in viele Splitter zerbrochen, die für einen menschlichen Willen viel leichter zu kontrollieren waren."

"I-Ich kann nicht sagen, woher diese Erinnerung gekommen ist. Vielleicht hatte ich in meinen Träumen Visionen von Tisiphone, und doch ... Und doch habe ich all das so klar gesehen ... Es war eine solche Macht in diesem Stein eingesperrt, solche Gelegenheiten ... Er könnte die Fähigkeiten unserer Navigatoren deutlich verstärken. Nein, er würde sie um ein Dutzendfaches verstärken! Doch der Preis war zu hoch. Nach wenigen Stunden der Nutzung hat der Stein den Verstand seines Wirts unweigerlich verbrannt. Daher hat Tisiphone den Monolith in viele Splitter zerbrochen, die für einen menschlichen Willen viel leichter zu kontrollieren waren."

languages.text: "Bu anının nereden geldiğini bilemiyorum. Belki düşlerimde Tisiphone'yle ilgili görüler görmüşümdür. Oysa tüm bunları o kadar net görmüştüm ki... Bu taşın içinde çok fazla güç, çok büyük imkanlar vardı. Bu taşla Rotacılarımızın kabiliyetlerini kat kat güçlendirebilir, hatta onlarca kat artırabilirdik! Lakin bedeli çok ağırdı. Sadece birkaç saat kullandıktan sonra taş, kullananın aklını daima yakıp kül eder oldu. Bu yüzden Monolit'i pek çok küçük parçaya bölmeye karar verildi. Böylece insan iradesince kontrol edilmesi kolaylaşacaktı."
languages.original_text: "I-I cannot say where this memory sprang from. Perhaps I saw visions of Tisiphone in my dreams, and yet... I have seen all this so clearly... There was such power locked within this stone, such opportunities... It would make our Navigators' abilities several times stronger. No, it would magnify them by a factor of dozens! But the price was too high. After mere hours of use, the stone would always burn the minds of its hosts. That is why Tisiphone broke the Monolith into many shards, which were far easier for a human will to control."

traits.locale_text: "Bu anının nereden geldiğini bilemiyorum. Belki düşlerimde Tisiphone'yle ilgili görüler görmüşümdür... Oysa tüm bunları o kadar net görmüştüm ki... Bu taşın içine kilitlenmiş çok güç vardı, çok büyük imkanlar... Bunun sayesinde Rotacılarımızın kabiliyetlerini kat kat güçlendirilebilirdi. Hatta onlarca kat artırılabilirdi! Lakin bedeli çok ağırdı. Sadece birkaç saat kullandıktan sonra taş, kullananın aklını daima yakıp kül ediyordu. Bu yüzden Monolit'i pek çok küçük parçaya bölmeye karar verildi. Böylece insan iradesinin bunu kontrol etmesi daha kolay olacaktı."
